intro: Pollinia monandra, commonly known as the orchid with clustered pollinia, is a species of orchid native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single, elongated flower with a specialized column that holds the pollinia. The plant produces showy, fragrant blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as bees and wasps. Its pollinia are clustered and adhere to the bodies of pollinators, facilitating efficient pollen transfer. The botanical features of Pollinia monandra make it an important subject in the study of orchid pollination mechanisms.
